The podcast app where it pays to listen.
Podcasting on the Lightning Network has taken off in 2022 - if you’re not paying attention, you probably should be.
Following a number of major controversies this year featuring the likes of Spotify, PayPal and Twitter, the threat of censorship, deplatforming and demonetisation is creeping into the mainstream conscience. Creators are beginning to realise that their freedom is at stake - but there is a solution. In the summer of 2020, The Podcast Index was born and the term Podcasting 2.0 first started appearing. The objective was to preserve podcasting as a platform for free speech (through decentralised content) and to retool podcasting as a platform of value (through decentralised money). In November 2020, Adam Curry published the first video demonstrating how listeners could stream small units of bitcoin called satoshis directly to a podcaster over the Lightning Network from a podcast player. Value for Value - the idea that audiences can choose to give back value which was so freely given to them - is not new. However, with Lightning we now have fast, frictionless and low-fee payments integrated seamlessly into the listening experience.
Against the backdrop of a bearish year for Bitcoin, the number of Lightning Podcasts has almost trebled and it's now easier than ever before for podcasters to start getting paid in bitcoin by their fans. In February 2022, Fountain launched the Podcaster Wallet, which allows podcasters to add a value block to their public RSS feed in just a couple of clicks. Since then, hosting companies and service providers have also start offering this service.

Clips created on Fountain

Not only are there many more podcasts you can support on Podcasting 2.0 apps like Fountain, it's now much easier to get onboarded as a listener than it was 12 months ago. In June 2022, Fountain launched Listen to Earn, which allows you to earn sats by listening to your favourite podcasts or by creating clips. When Fountain 0.6 launches in January 2023, you will be able to top up your Fountain wallet with a credit or debit card. It is no longer necessary for listeners to own bitcoin in order to begin. For mass-adoption of Value to Value, this is vitally important.
While there is great momentum behind Podcasting 2.0 and Value for Value, we have yet to reach an inflection point. In 2023 Fountain will be focusing on the following challenges and opportunities: Creators Unsurprisingly, the early adopters are primarily (but not exclusively) podcasts about Bitcoin. As this new ecosystem becomes more accessible to those who are not already acquainted with Bitcoin, we hope to see more shows and networks from a diverse range of categories introducing their audience to Value for Value. Feature Adoption For mass adoption of exciting Podcasting 2.0 features such as live, video and chapters, we are going to need the major podcast hosting services to step up and make them available. Until then, podcasters who want these features must find hosting services that offer them or possess the technical knowledge required to edit their own RSS feeds. Interoperability The beauty of building on an open protocol like the Bitcoin Lightning Network is that finally different podcast apps can talk to each other. We are no longer building features in silos. For example, when listeners on Breez boost a podcast it will be displayed in Fountain. We have only scratched the surface of what can be achieved by building innovative features on top of it. Compatibility Currently Fountain is only supported as a mobile app on iOS and Android devices. In 2023 we plan to offer a fully-featured web app and support on other popular platforms, devices and accessories including Chromecast, Alexa and Apple Watch.
Fountain Rewind is an annual retrospective on podcasting on the Lightning Network. Click here to skip to the awards.
In the summer of 2020, The Podcast Index was born and the term Podcasting 2.0 first started appearing. The aim was to preserve podcasting as a platform for free speech (through decentralised content) and to retool podcasting as a platform of value (through decentralised money). In November 2020, Adam Curry published the first video demonstrating how listeners could stream small units of bitcoin called satoshis directly to a podcaster over the Lightning Network from a podcast player. Value for Value - the idea that audiences can choose to give back value which was so freely given to us - is not new. However, this new specification finally offered the payment rails for fast, frictionless and low-fee settlement of peer-to-peer transactions. Fast forward two years and there are now over 10,000 podcasts who are part of this quickly-evolving ecosystem. Against the backdrop of a bearish year for Bitcoin in 2022, the number of Lightning Podcasts has almost trebled and shows no signs of slowing down.
Total number of podcasts with a Value block in their RSS feed
It's now easier than ever before for podcasters to start getting paid in Bitcoin by their fans. In February 2022, Fountain launched the Podcaster Wallet, which allows podcasters to add a value block to their public RSS feed in just a couple of clicks. Since then, hosting companies and service providers have also start offering this service. Following a number of major controversies this year featuring the likes of Spotify and PayPal, the threats of censorship, deplatforming and demonetisation is creeping into the mainstream conscience. Creators are beginning to realise that their freedom is a stake - and this is where the openness and independence of Podcasting 2.0 has the edge.
Total number of sats sent on Fountain (boosts, streams, likes)
Not only are there many more podcasts you can support on Podcasting 2.0 apps like Fountain, it's now much easier to get onboarded as a listener than it was 12 months ago. In June 2022, Fountain launched Listen to Earn, which allows you to earn sats by listening to any of your favourite podcasts or by creating valuable clips. In December 2022, we made it possible to top up your Fountain wallet with a credit or debit card. Because of these features, it's no longer necessary for listeners to own bitcoin or know anything about bitcoin in order to begin. For mass-adoption of Value to Value, this is vitally important.

Most supported shows

The top 50 shows by value supported in 2022
1. Podcasting 2.0
It should be no surprise that Adam Curry and Dave Jones’s weekly board meeting is the most supported show for a second year running. If there was no PodcastIndex there would be no Value for Value via Lightning - and Fountain as we know it would not exist. Looking at the sheer volume of generous donations to support the cause, it is clear that Fountain listeners recognise this too. Every sat you send to Podcasting 2.0 helps protect, preserve and extend the open podcast ecosystem - money well spent.
2. No Agenda
Adam Curry and John C. Dvorak are the original pioneers of Value for Value in podcasting. Their seminal news and politics show has been 100% audience-funded since 2005. No ads, no sponsors - just contributions from their loyal legion of listeners in the form of time, talent and treasure. A great example of the non-monetary support the show receives is the No Agenda Art Generator, where fans can upload show artwork for Adam and John to choose from. Every No Agenda listener is a producer of the show - this is completely unique.
3. Rabbit Hole Recap
Since Rabbit Hole Recap launched on its own podcast feed in June 2022, barely a week has gone by where the show has not featured in the Hot on Fountain charts. It also has one of the most engaged community of listeners (affectionately known as ‘freaks’), so the comments are always charged with opinion and debate. Like many of the other successful shows in this list, they read out the comments from listeners who boost on Value for Value podcast apps - a tried and tested method for garnering support and getting the audience involved.
4. Citadel Dispatch
Citadel Dispatch is an interactive live show about bitcoin and freedom tech hosted by Matt Odell. In passionate conversations with inspiring guests such as cypherpunk Adam Back, Odell covers open-source projects and sensitive subjects like privacy and censorship in greater depth and with unwavering humility.
5. LINUX Unplugged
LINUX Unplugged is a weekly talk show about open-source collaboration with no script and no limits, hosted by Chris Fisher, Wes Payne and Brent Gervais. The Jupiter Broadcasting network is also behind a handful of other popular shows that you can support on Fountain, including Office Hours, Coder Radio and Self-Hosted.
6. Moe Factz with Adam Curry
Episodes of Moe Factz with Adam Curry don't come around often - but when they do, they never miss. Each one opens in exactly the same way - the two friends spin a roulette wheel to set the topic then riveting discussion ensues for the next 3-4 hours. And of course it wouldn't be an Adam Curry production without a generous serving of audio clips and effects. An absorbing experience from end to end.
7. The Survival Podcast
With more than 3,000 episodes under his belt, Jack Spirko is a true veteran of the game. The Survival Podcast was the most boosted show on Fountain in 2022 and had over 1,000 supporters - more than any other show in the top ten. If you value your own freedom and independence, you should listen to The Survival Podcast. Why? Because in this world you can't rely on anybody except yourself.
8. Curry and The Keeper
Yes, Adam Curry has four shows in the top ten - don't act surprised. On Curry and The Keeper, Adam and his wife Tina discuss life, love and wine with levity and laughter. Since the show launched in December 2021 it has quickly established itself as a feel-good favourite. The coolest thing is it's only available on Podcasting 2.0 apps, so you won't find it in Apple and Spotify.
9. TFTC: A Bitcoin Podcast
Tales from the Crypt is a podcast about Bitcoin hosted by Marty Bent. Its mission is to offer the world a media company that fights against the noise and brings the populace out from the fog created by the mass psychosis that has gripped the world.
10. Bowl After Bowl
Spencer and Laurien may have the fewest number of supporters of all the shows in the top ten but they have earned their place due to the sheer number of sats their loyal listeners send. Don't be fooled into thinking Bowl After Bowl is a show about getting high (although there are bowls involved). Some might place it in the global affairs category. We would put it in a category of it's own as there really is nothing else quite like it.

Honourable mentions

Other notable achievements in 2022
MOST SUPPORTED EPISODE BY VALUE

Podcasting 2.0

MOST SUPPORTERS
The Path To Bitcoin
Since this show was added to the Lightning Network in July 2022 it has had almost 2,000 unique supporters. Fountain Promotions played an important part in its growth strategy. So far they have distributed a total of 4.6 million sats across 5 promotions and generated over 32,000 listens (that's 142 sats per listen). This is a brilliant case study which proves that offering new listeners an incentive to try out your podcast is a cost-efficient tool for reaching new audiences.

MOST CLIPPED
What Bitcoin Did with Peter McCormack
With over 1 million downloads a month and the most inspiring guests in the game, Peter McCormack's podcast is arguably one of the most influential podcasts in Bitcoin. His show has been clipped over 350 times on Fountain this year.
EPISODE WITH THE MOST CLIPS

MOST SATS STREAMED TO LISTENERS
The Pomp Podcast
Pomp has streamed over 13 million sats to Fountain listeners since joining the platform in June 2022. Rather than seeing Fountain as a revenue source, he sees it as an opportunity to share revenue with his fans and a means of reaching new audiences.
HIGHEST AVERAGE SUPPORT VALUE
Kwarantanna z bitcoinem
With only 3 supporters, this Polish podcast has stacked over 850,000 sats this year since claiming their show in June. This proves an important point - value for value is not a game of numbers, it’s a game of value. In other words, Value for Value does not require you to have the biggest audience, you just have to find the right way to ask your audience to support. If podcasters simply focus on creating value for listeners and asking for some value back, the sats will flow.
